reviews.sentence: Fantastic resort incredible pool. We stayed at The Conrad with a group of family and friends for 4 nights and it was just fantastic. The view upon arrival is spectacular as are the enormous pools. Despite the size of the property at times we were the only ones in the polThe resort is fantastic for the whole family but there are pockets of calm just for couples. We were upgraded to a Conrad Suite and it was enormous. This upgrade also enabled us to swim in the pool reserved for the suites and eat breakfast away from the main breakfast area. Speaking of breakfast the range and quality of food on offer was exceptional. Every type of breakfast food you could imagineThe area is much quieter than Seminyak and Kuta but still close to many restaurants and shops. The staff are fantastic and we had definitely consider staying at The Conrad again.

Beautiful all round resort hotel. There really is not anything to complain about at this wonderful hotel. it is close proximity to the beach made it so ideal to stroll down there for a swim or just to chill. I enjoyed the outdoor pools of this hotel immensely. The food ambience and staff service was excellent. I came here for my friends wedding also held at the hotel in August 2013 but the date at the top is Oct 2014 as I can not choose a date before that for this review.

EAT to your hearts content PRAY that you will be back and LOVE this place. I spent a week here from January 16th to 23rd 2016. From the moment we arrived to our drop off in Ubud by the hotels car my girlfriend and I were in love with the Conrad and the Balinese people. Due to my Diamond status we were upgraded to an oceanfront suite with its own hot spa where I would watch the sun rise every morning. The staff were amazing as others have mentioned. I kept wondering is it Conrad training or Balinese culture. Most likely a combination of both. The service is impeccable and comes with the warmest of smiles. Never have I been treated so well in my life. They even wanted to present a cake for my birthday on arrival but upon discovering I was gluten free promptly delivered a fruit plate with Happy Birthday written in chocolate syrup. As for amenities the breakfast buffet is tremendous and will satisfy American European and Asian palates with its offerings. We also used the wonderful fitness center regularly and took two escorted bike rides in the area thanks BudiThe only downside is the beach as with many properties in this area it is simply not inviting. You will be more than happy with the vast pool network and its plentiful lounges. There are few places on the planet like Bali and left cherish it.

A great hotel excellent service from everyone superb pools and facilities. We arrived back in the UK two weeks ago from having ended our months holiday in AustralAsia with a seven night stay at the Conrad Bali. A wonderful hotel experience for a relaxing stay in Bali. We had breakfast included which was buffet style that had everything you could ever want for a good breakfast whatever your Nationality. We had a garden view room on the third floor on the most northerly wing of the hotel it was large by most hotel standards and very well appointed with a large balcony sufficient for two loungers we asked for a second which was brought to us within 15 mins of asking and table and two chairs. The swimming pools are fabulous with a large central pool plus a pool that stretches around the hotel complex from one side to the other with a small sand beach area at each end it was always immaculately clean. No shortage of loungers whatever time of day we wanted to relax. The restaurants are a bit expensive by UK standards. but if you stay in a 5 hotel with an adjacent beach location its what you probably should expect. They do a meal value package at the Eight Degrees South Restaurant that is right on the beach. for £ 50 person you get a 3 course meal and unlimited drinks. If you do not want to run to the expense of hotel meals there are two good restaurants nearby we can recommend. The Paon Doeloe inside the Taman Bhagwan. its just a 10 minute stroll Northwards along the beach. try it first for lunch best Spring Rolls ever. £ 150 with a beer £ 2. ask them to pick you up at the Hotel and take you back for evening dinner. no charge best not to walk at night. Other restaurant is Bumbu Bali which is 20 minute walk going northwards. great food even if a little expensive by Bali standards £ 30 for two persons inc drinks. the Hotel will book you a table and again Bumbu offers free pick up and return from to Hotel 5 mins in car. There is also a free bus shuttle from the hotel every hour from 90am to 930pm to the Bali Collection at Nusa Dua 10 minutes drive away which is a large modern shopping outlet branded numerous restaurants catering for every Nationality at very affordable prices if you go in the day there is a lovely walk through some parkland and a long sandy beach really nice there. On a point of service excellence we had a minor issue with our room two days before we departed. it was resolved within 60 minutes by Manager Made Sumantara who was very attentive. We met Stephane Roubin who is Director of Operations of the Conrad as we were leaving a very nice gentleman and he should be commended on running a wonderful hotel with some of the most courteous and helpful staff we have ever experienced during our travels around the World. Great job.

An oasis in Bali. Long before there was social media world travelers depended not on what friends and family told them which hotels to stay in and why. I have now been travelling for over 35 years and had written many reviews on Tripadvisor and post them as accurately as I can. I also try to make my reviews constructive and make suggestions for improving the customers experience. Many hotel brands now face the challenge of tactfully and gracefully dealing with hotel reviews that often come from travelers who are far from objective and sometimes make no sense. It is very important for hotels to realize that properties that practice successful brand management are almost four times as likely to receive a booking as a hotel that does not. Check in Experience Including recognition of the status of the hotel guest•. We were checked in the main lobby or check in area as DiamondTop Tier members of the Hilton program•. Usually Top Tier members are checked in in the Lounge so as to make the top tier member feel exclusive and important comparing to the IC Bali as well as the London Gatwick Hilton•. Even though we had arranged for a hotel pick up it seemed as if the hotel staff was not prepared as I was not addressed by name until a few clicks of the computer•. At the IC Bali the staff was waiting for our arrival as we had pre arranged our pick up and they were well aware of our arrival. That just makes the check in experience memorable and special. Staffs Engagement Level•. Overall the staff in the Lounge did seem very interested in what they were doing. All of them were great and I have to mention names Simponi Ratna Dasa Swartini Adnyana JuniRom Asignment• Thanks to the Hilton Honours program and hotel management that we were upgraded to the suites section of the hotel. This is an exclusive wing with a separate pool with cabanas•. The room was beautiful with a separate living dining and bedroom. The bathroom was perfect with a rain shower as well as a tub and a separate toilet• Toiletries provided were of a high caliber paraben fre•. There was no welcome gift and no fruit. I had to call the reception and inquire about it and was told it was not normal practice to have welcome fruit or a welcome gift. They did eventually send some fruit and 2 stuffed toys. Breakfast Lounge• Breakfast was served in the RIN restaurant for Suites guests• Breakfast was made to order from an a la cart menu. •. On day one we were not presented with a menu and the staff member who took our order messed up on our order of egg whites. This is a minor mistake and could have been due to language issues. But over the next few days our order was taken and delivered acordingly•. We also noted that there was never any cold bottled water when we asked on 2 occasions. We were given warm water botles•. The evening lounge and canapes were good except that on the last night we were served almost frozen Chinese steamed buns. I brought this to the attention of the staff and they noted the issue and presented us with teriyaki alternative canapes•. The lounge staff should enforce strict attire as mentioned somewhere in the lounge paraphernalia that guests must be dressed in business casual attire. But we noticed guests that had their shoes off with their feet on the sofa as well as someone who was in flip flops and a tank top singlet•. I feel that this just lowers the standard of the lounge and the experience for others. Hotel Grounds•. The pool for the suites section was amazing with a relaxing feeling except for continuous construction noise from the adjacent construction of villas for the hotel•. Guests were provided with bottles of water and towels•. The gym was adequate as I used it daily in the mornings it had free weights and some machines as well as treadmils•. We also noted an absence of a mini bar for the Suites pool guests as in the IC Bali. It makes it easy for guests to walk over to the bar and order a drink. The IC Balis pool bar also had banana fritters and little surprises like that for pool guests. Check Out Experience•. We arranged for an Uber pick up and I think it was Juni who assisted us with the check out process in the lounge. Do I recommend this propertyYes I do recommend this property as it is an oasis for those longing to have a lovely stay in Bali away from the maddening crowds of Kuta and Seminyak.

Lovely hotel. The facilities and the staff at this hotel are great. it is a great place if you just want to lay by the pool and eat at the hotel. There is not any shopping or good restaurants close that we found but we were only here for 2 days. Comfy beds and big breakfast buffet.

Best place to stay in Bali. Conrad Bali is like a mini paradise. We stayed in their Ocean View Suite and the view was much more spectacular than we expected. We were there on a full moon night and the view that night was like an experience in it is own. Coming to the hotel the room was very clean and fresh. The linen the towels the washrooms everything was shining. We have two babies and the resort welcomed them with a cute little toiletry hamper from Johnson and Johnson. It was a very sweet gesture. The restaurants have super yummy food. We tried all the restaurants and kept licking our fingers all the time yes we are big time foodies. The restaurants can be full a lot of times esp the beachfront restaurant. so it is a good idea to book a table beforehand. The deserts as the beachfront restaurant are so good that I could keep eating there all my life. The breakfast spread was awesome one of the best I have seen. The ambience is also excellent. My elder daughter was completely engaged with the Koi fishes of their breakfast area pond while we sat back and enjoyed every morsel. They have massive pools on all sides of the resort which have bridges going over them. So it is visually very appealing. They also have huge trees around the pools so swimming in the Bali sun is not that bad even during the time the trees provide a lot of shaded area to laze around in the pool. There are a lot of water sports that one can indulge in. Sadly we could not go for it as we have small babies. The hotel also has shuttles for some nearby popular places. it is free of cost. All in all we had a great stay in Conrad Bali. We would like to thank each and every staff for all their effort to keep the hotel so beautiful and happy with their smiles Looking forward to go back again already.

Very helpful staff. Service for executive lounge is very nice. very helpful and thoughtfullaundry service is good as well. only problem is breakfast does not meet a 5 stars hotel standard. less food to choose. overall service is good with nice pools and bars.

Very nice and friendly hotel. This vacation trip I decided to try the suite room. And so glad we did choose the suite room. The room is nice and big. I wis i knew that we get free loundry in advance so that we could bring less clothes instead. The beach is very close and clean other than a few seaweed which is normal. Sea is very calm and shalow. Staff are very attentive. The only downside that I could think of is the RIN Japanese restaurant. Strangely it took them forever to prepare sushi and salmon sashimi.

Welcome Home from wonderful staff. Like a previous visitor we have just had our 15th visit to Conrad Bali. We first visited in 205 and have returned every year since then. Of course the hotel is now older but it is exceedingly well maintained and updated. What never changes though is the excellence of the staff. We come back from Bali feeling renewed and relaxed. As we spend almost every day down by the beach we would like to say a big thank you to the staff at Azure. They take such good care of us making sure that we have everything we need. I never fail to be in admiration for them. They take care of guests over such a large area and yet somehow much to keep smiling when guests are being demanding and difficult even when they themselves are feeling hot and tired. Of course all the staff at the Conrad are superb and look after us so well and I do hope that they know how well they succeed. It is because of the staff that we return. Yes the hotel is beautiful and it is great to be close to the sea but we could find that a lot closer to home but not the warmth and care of such great people. I have often read reviews where guests complain about the price of food. Yes it is expensive compared with local restaurants but it is of very high quality and the menu is frequently changed to reflect the tastes of the guests. It may be cheaper to eat elsewhere but the Conrad has such a beautiful setting and of course often has evening entertainment. Not only that but the chefs will willingly take care of any special requests and dislikes such as my hatred of corianderI have also read complaints about weddings but they do not go on past 10 pm and there are controls over how much noise is allowed. Besides if you have a young family you can ask to be in a quieter room. We will continue to keep going back as long as we are able because although it is a long long way it is so worth it once we are there.

Average for Bali. We stayed at the Conrad after having spent time at other hotels as our final stop. Overall it was an average stay Room was quite dated so the refub being undertaken seems well overdue 15 year was mentioned my the management. We had a constant leak in the toilet ceiling. Was informed several times it was fixed still had a leak on checking out Asked to pay for a Bale roofed area with a mattress. while no normal polside loungers were available for our toddler to be in the shade. They created a bit of a fuss over this. The Bales are basic but provide the charm of the Conrads landscape. With those chargeable felt like a pay as you go Conrad. With several issues discussed with a duty manager a free spa session was provided. Good gesture but overall still left us with a frustrating bad experience of our final days in Bali so not happy overal We found the breakfast average compared to other Conrad properties we have stayed at in the past and also for Bali average having spent time at other 5 resorts. Tips the breakfast was in the Suku restaurant originally but was moved to a smaller crammed Spice room due to the refurb. Clarify as this not the best experience if you are expecting a proper spread based on what you are paying for Do not pay specifically for the Bale to relax. it is a silly idea when you have already paid to stay there and it is a basic facility. Did not check if they also charge for the hamock The refurb will be a while and therefore pool closures. restaurant changes etc will not give you the best of a Conrad something to keep in mind.

Wonderful Hotel in Bali. My wife and I booked a 4 night stay at this property prior to taking a cruise from Bali to Australia. The hotel is quite lovely and sort of set off by itself on beautiful grounds. The room was lovely and the garden and pool views terrific. It is quite a large property and it took us a few trips to learn how to quickly make our way through the property to the several restaurants pools and spa. The included breakfasts are buffet style and immense in scope and options. The evening meals were likewise served buffet style and many options were available. One night when not very hungry we chose to go to the beachside restaurant for cocktails and tapas. They were excellent as was the service. The staff desk clerks concierge bell men etc were all delightful and very helpful. The room was quite large and well appointed if a bit far from from the main lobby. The shower controls were quite unfamiliar and took some experimenting to get them correct but once we did they worked very well. Unfortunately parts of the hotel are under some construction but that did not really bother us much as being there in the rainy season. Prices were quite reasonable by American standards.

Five star facilities. We have been going to Conrad Suites for nearly a decade. Always enjoyed our stay but as the newer resorts are built there ’s a need to upgrade the Suites facilities. Well done to the staff for making our stay enjoyable. The free laundry is a great bonus on top on the usual club entitlements.
Hello there. I really need your help. The Conrad in Bai owns me money and blocked me on all social media. I hope you can help me because it ’s put shades on all brands.

Will it come again. I had a problem with the hotel before. The manager went to show me something again but I did not know what he was showing. Stay for 5 days. SuiteTwo childrenThere are many places under construction. In particular the Kurakura kids club is closed and the temporary kids club is the worst. In the afternoon tea time in the lobby lounge cocktails occur 30 minutes after the first orderlet us order a cocktail at happy hours in Lin bring it in 10 minutes. Pool water quality was really bad. It was too dirty. Breakfast was also closed at Sukusu and was available at Spice. Too small a breakfast room. I would rather go to Lyn if she gave me the same degree. Having used the spa twice cucumber scrub is okay. But the other thing. Only Lyn is the only place to use and evaluate well. I would like to thank Suli전에 문제가 있었던 호텔. 메니저가 다시금 뭔가 보여주겠다 해서 갔지만 뭘 보여준다는 건지 알수 없었다5일의 스테이스윗룸2명의 소아공사중인 곳이 많음특히 쿠라쿠라 kids club이 문을 닫았고 임시로 만든 키즈클럽은 정말 최악임로비 라운지에서 afternoon tea 타임에 칵테일은 첫 오더 후 30분이 지나서 나옴린에서의 happy hours 에서 칵테일 주문하자. 10분안에 가져다 줌수영장. 수질은 정말 안좋았음 너무 더러웠음 조식도 수쿠가 닫아서 스파이스에서 이용할수 있었음 너무 작은 조식당 린이 같은 정도를 제공한다면 차라리 린으로 가고 싶었음스파를 2번 이용해본 바 오이스크럽은 괜찮음 그러나 다른건. 유일하게 이용하고. 좋은 평가를 할곳은 린 뿐임Suli에게 감사하다고 전하고 싶다.

A second visit there will certainly be a third. This was a second visit five years on from a first. Despite current renovations the decision to return was more than justified. The hotel lies about ten minutes ’ drive outside the main Nusa Dua complex of five star hotels around the Bali Colection xhoping complex. That is only part of its charm you can walk out of the front door of the hotel and be part of the real local Bali. The hotel ’s charm is however largely down to its staff. Extremely well trained and natively pleasant. every member of staff. whether cleaning the pools early in the morning or attending to your table at dinner would greet you with a smile and an offer of assistance. The food and service at 8 degrees South made us wonder why you would venture to the seaside hit and misses of Jinbaran so this time we did n’t. Tri in particular runs a smooth and pleasant ship in the restaurant he and his staff hit just the right balance between happily attending to your meal without interrupting the flow of conversation. The rooms though well sized and really well organised are in need of some renovation but I hope their slightly retro feel is never lost. While I prefer rooms in the main wings of the hotel to those in the Conrad Suites which are rather further from the beach if your Hilton Honors membership gets you Conrad Suites access this is an added bonus breakfast afternoon tea and evening canapés and drinks in a gorgeous lounge overlooking the Conrad Suites pool are all extremely pleasant. Oh the pools I almost forgot the pools and how could I forget these. Who designed this hotel. How did they manage to integrate about seven pools and make each quite different to the other so that for a whole week you could just go from one to the other as though you were staying at different resorts. And even to get from one to the other they managed to take you through walkways along a succession of ponds water features and waterfalls that all exude subtle serenity of soul and spirit. We got there after a stressful business week in bustly Singapore and left only yesterday after a sunrise swim in balmy waters. much refreshed relaxed and ready for busier times until the next visit.

Quality service by Great staffs. I had been stay in conrad Bali beginning of Feb for two nights for leisure purpose. Due to raining season it was great I could reach airport for hotel only 20 mins by hotel car. The driver Gustil is extremely friend in English and he was extremely hospitable. Upon arrival due to Chinese tourist group was in reception counter. To make extremely efficient check in was By Agung. Sincerely he apologised the inconvenient circumstances which I had to wait quite long to wait for my turn for checking in. On top of I was impressed by his engagement skill. He made a positive impression upon arrival. I was escorted room by Suaudi. He fully explained all facility information and room orientation was made by him. Even his English skill was not so good but I really felt his genuine hospitality. Cleanliness in the room was fantastic. Even one hair can not see during my stay. I realised compare to another hilton worldwide property size of bed was different. It was quite bigger than any other properties which made me happy. Regarding room condition I will be pending for next visit due to fully aware on going and started renovation work. At night I went to reception to borrow some stationary due to no business centre in this property. Efie was the one who assisted me with speedy and prompt action. She is also the one who really can engage with guest and she can make emotional connection. Breakfast venue was very clouded. I was a bit disappointed due to coffee was not served even staff came to approach me. Finally I waited almost 30 mins to get coffee. I ca n’t recall his name but one of senior staff who is muddle age it could be in charge. he immediately suggested I can bring back coffee to my room. His service recovery was excellent. Overall better have more manning for breakfast venue. During stay I was in and out fromHotel. Always greeted me by mentioning my name was Niken. She is also the one who can go for extra mile for guest by engagement. Overall experience staffs are really friendly and hospitable. I could n’t mention the name here all but it is sure all staffs who is well trained made my stay special. Once again thank you so much for providing me genuine hospitality. I am looking forward coming back to stay after the renovation all completed. Or I might be back soon cause I really liked the quality of service in conrad Bali. Regards Akiko Goto.

Fair. Service and breakfast were ok. Not a five star hotel. Everything was realy expencive compared to other hotels in Bali. Not clean pools were dirty. Ocean view room not really ocean view trees and pools and garden mostly. Location not good the beach is unswimable and dirty.

Yet another fantastic stay at The Conrad Bali. A group of 12 of us went to Bali and we stayed at the Conrad. We have all previously stayed before and based on our exceptional experience last time when my brother had his wedding there we decided to return. It ’s situated overlooking a beautiful beach. When you enter the hotel it ’s ever so beautiful. From the reception area you can see the swimming pool and blue sea. True paradise. After check in we went to our rooms which were absolutely gorgeous. Such tasteful decor and views to die for. We dined at the restaurants on a few occasions and we were very impressed with the food and service. Breakfast was so delicious with so much choice you can not manage it all. Everyday I had something different just so I could try it all. After two weeks I was still trying new things everyday. A member of staff that stood out so much and always went out of his way to look after us at breakfast was Mangku. But all the other staff were also amazing. Our previous stay and this one Agung really looked after us. Such an exceptional member of staff that goes the extra mile. He is the reason for us returning and will be returning again next year as well. Thank you so much for all of your help time and effort to make our stay Memorable and outstanding. We really appreciate it. We met the General Manager Markus Kocsh who kindly came to introduce himself to us. Such a lovely man. I can understand why the staff are so happy when they have a manager like him. We celebrated two birthdays when we were there and the staff arranged birthday cakes in the room. We were so flattered and grateful. Thank you again. The hotel is great for kids as well as adults. All the staff were so friendly helpful and nice. A special thank you to Fridayanti Sujatini Rudiyani and Eka for looking after us so well in the bar by reception. We look forward to seeing you all again next Easter.

Not that worth for five star. Good location. The room is quite big. When we arrived the room is not ready yet and The staff were lied about our availability room. we ordered king bed room first they said its full already even we ordered it. But when we push them finally they gave us the king bed room. And when we entered the room for the first time the floor is not clean. When you walk you can feel the dirt. But they directly cleaned it again when I asked them. It ’s under renovation when we came so a lot of facility is closed however they told us before. Overall I ’m quite disappointed stay here. Better choose other five star hotel with the same price to stay next time.

Family Wedding Getaway. Our recent stay in Conrad Bali was superb. Probably the best beach resort I personally experienced. The room was a king size bedroom. Large enough to accommodate two adults and two children without additional beds very clean comfortable nicely decorated and covered our needs. The only frustrating part is I had to request housekeeping daily additional bath towels for my children. Thumbs up to Conrad transportation and concierge services. They were able to entertain all my requests professionally. Reception staff need to improve. Our keycard was not working and we requested for replacement cards. Instead the reception staff was enquiring about our incidental charges instead of replacing our cards. We already had deposit with the hotel and one more night before checking out. That was an unpleasant experience. Overall all the staff members were professional and pleasant. I recommend this beach resort if you want to be in Nusa Dua area.

Horrible experience. Canceled reservation because we got robbed and lost passports wallets and phones. But 2 weeks later we got charged for the stay complete disapointment and horrible experience. I would never book here again.

A Wonderful Experience. I spent five nights at the Conrad Bali at the beginning of November and I must say as a solo traveler still getting used to that situation I was made to feel like family. From the moment I was picked up by their pre arranged transport until the moment I checked out staff could not have been more accommodating. The resort itself was most relaxing and quite tranquil despite some ongoing renovations. Walking to breakfast every morning was always a treat as staff would greet me in such a warm and genuine manner. The Balinese I encountered on this trip were such a kind and gentle people helping me in any way they could even if it were not in their own self interest. Sekar the hotel concierge went out of her way to engage me in lively conversation whenever our paths crossed. She helped me resolve a billing issue with such grace and aplomb making me feel far more important than warranted. Within the second day of my stay I was already being addressed by name and my specific preferences at the Suku restaurant Executive Lounge and Suites Pool committed to memory by staff. I was mightily impressed especially given the size of the resort. As a Hilton Honors Diamond member I was upgraded to a beautiful suite really too large for me on my own but appreciated nonetheless. It overlooked the Suites Pool and the large balcony was most inviting with a table chairs and large settee. A breeze often created a comfortable temperature in which to watch the setting sun. Quite romantic for guests traveling as a couple which almost all were. Everything in the suite was in perfect working order and a wet bar two mini refrigerators a capsule coffee maker dinnerware glassware and various other kitchen oriented apparatus were also provided in the dining area. The bed was superbly comfortable and although described as two twins actually was comprised of two king or queen sized beds joined to form an enormous unit easily large enough for four. The rainfall shower provided a steady supply of hot water and the quiet HVAC system was efficient in keeping the room at a perfectly comfortable setting. Buffet breakfast at Suku was always a treat that I eagerly anticipated after rising in the morning. Staff were so friendly plying me with the French press coffee that I so urgently needed to keep up my energy level. The selection was extensive and changed daily. As in most hotels in Asia Western Asian and Japanese fare was offered. Lamb beef chicken fish and vegetarian dishes were in the daily rotation as was sushi cheese and cold cuts. One could order à la carte or from the egg station and I thoroughly enjoyed the Eggs Benedict made with chicken rather than pork back bacon. Bread and pastries were also of a high standard perhaps not as good as some venues in Europe but certainly better than most in the Americas. In the evenings the Executive Lounge provided canapés and snacks as well as an assortment of beverages including wine beer spirits and mixed cocktails. It was always such a pleasant way to end the day. Staff there were always solicitous and polite to a fault. Staff at all the pools were quick to bring cold water and wet towels to refresh both ones thirst and extremities. There were always loungers available and the chaise cushions and towels were thick and very comfortable. Umbrellas were set up for all loungers providing ample shade from the hot sun. The grounds were immaculately maintained and the shrubs trees flowers and extensive landscaping were most attractive in providing a beautiful tropical setting. I must say given my experiences during this visit I will be putting Bali and the Conrad back in the forefront of my future travels. If you have n’t yet visited I encourage you to do so and consider staying at the Conrad if at all possible.

Outstanding so beautiful so worth it. ♥ ️ Excellent service from arriving and booking our stay last minute at reception for the entirety of our 5 day stay. We stayed in the Conrad Suite and although a little more pricey it was worth it. The amenities were amazing and the rooms were beautiful our bed was huge and so comfortable we had our own walk in wardrobe enroute to our bathroom the living area was open plan with the dining kitchen area they gave us a selection of fruit and specialist coffees as well as plenty of free bottles drinking water the laundry service was free daily everything we could possibly want or need was providedAl the pools were lovely the Conrad Suites pool was tranquil and perfect for escape the main pool was so big and picturesque you had a stunning view of the beach or the hotel from either end the pool surrounding the main hotel was playful and had sand surfacing by the beach perfect for families with children. The hotel itself is situated on the beach front and has a few restaurants scattered around it is premises. Our favourite was Rin specialising in Japanese cuisine the tepenyaki set menu there is a must. ♥ ️ Afternoon tea was served there daily as part of our stay which included free drinks for 2 hours. needless to say we took advantage of this. Breakfast was served in Suku Restaurant where the only problem would be deciding on what to eat as the array of foods was so vast. The evening meals there were also delicious. We happened to be staying while they were renovating some of the rooms meaning the hotel was a lot quieter than usual which was perfect for our romantic break. One of our waiters even invited us to their staff do as they were having a party by the pool one evening with an extensive buffet and all the free drink you could manage. We were so well looked after and had so much fun. You can see just how stunning the place is from my photos. All in all an exceptional stay ♥ ️.

Conrad Bali Poor. Really not what we would expect from a 5star resort. Rooms were nice but toilet smelt constantly and shower was hot and cold low to high pressure constantly. Had 2 lunches and 3 dinners and all of them were poor in some fashion including but not limited to wrong food delivered 2 hour wait to be served. entrees and mains served at the same time steak served rare and well done on the same plate excuses that they had a large table and they keep ordering so we had to wait. Might have been excusable if the restaurants were busy but they were not. A number of guests left restaurants on different nights because of the slow service.

One of the worst properties I have experienced. Where do I start. in summary I can say Conrad Bali has been the worst and most disapointing experience in all my years of travel and to top it off as a diamond hilton member. No proper information given during checkin housekeeping bad suki restaurant staff for dinner is below average reception staff do nt have all the information required. need I go on. The reception staff did not even give us a tour of the property or benefits that I am entitled to as member so for 4 nights I was discovering benefits I am eligible to like the club access lounge with breakfast and separate evening hours. I am eligible for an upgrade to a suite and the reception person told me the lagoon view is better as it is renovated versus the suites are not and I am better off. So I believed the person and chose to not upgrade without even viewing which is a big mistake. Tonight I saw the area and benefits close to it and it just made me feel cheated and left at a big disadvantage. I am still at the property and leaving tomorrow tonight I tried the Rin restaurant which is very good in terms of service and food options quality. I did nt even know they had a set menu offer with. They needs to get a A and they were surprised to know I have been staying for 4 nights and not visited or dined with them. And it goes back to the level of service and there is no proper information told to you or in the room which is such a disappointment especially when you are on a holiday or even a first time visitor to Bali. Housekeeping kept making mistakes like leaving the ashtray inside the room left used glass and spoon back amongst other minor issues. On my 2nd day I went to complain to the duty manager and they sent me a person who I assumed was in guest relations or a manager. The person listened to me took my feedback and that evening left me a note to change my room if I was interested but with no followup or call is that the way you treat an upset customer. To make things worse I was made aware that she was in finance and not even the right person to raise my concern. how careless can they be. In all I should have stayed in Ubud as I was advised but as it was a Hilton property and having had a good stay in all of my Hilton stays worldwide I took a chance even with bad reviews I read. good lesson learnt and never returning to this hotel again. Conrad Bali needs to take a refresher course in hospitality and service to attract clients and customers to this beautiful property.

Another jewel in Hiltons crown. From the moment we checked in to the check out the service provided by the staff was exemplorary. Upon arrival we were greeted at the check in with a welcoming drink and a cold towel. The Hotel and grounds and garden offer unaduterated luxuary. All the rooms are spacious and well equiped with tea and coffee making facilites the bathroom was provided with delux toiletries. We were upgraded to a suite which was beautifully prepared with platter of fruit etc. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff which offer a stellar service. The variety of food on offer in the 5 onsite restuarnts is fantastic and certainly would please the most fastidious palate. The breakfast in the Suku restuarnt is a full multinational buffet with chefs in attendance to cater for every culenary requirment. There is a choice of several swimming pools as well as a beautiful beach. The hotel offers various themed nights in the different restuarants. The executive lounge offers a traditional afternoon tea and a cocktail hours withe delicious canapes and bite produced by the chef in attendance.
Very Good. Wonderful breakfast and attentive restaurant staff. Pricey water sports.

Perfect hotel but disappointing surrounding. We really enjoyed our stay at Conrad. The hotel is just perfect. The architecture and lay out of the hotel is made to relax and enjoy your stay. The multiple pools are amazing warm we could even have a swim at 90 after a touring day. The staff are amazing caring and efficient. Room beautiful and breakfast buffet with multiple choice which are renewed every day. Really great. The only negative point for us was the beach really small dirty with algae and plastic. They also offer a lot of water sport activities from 10 to late afternoon. Therefore sometimes you feel like being next to a motorway with the fumes as a plus. We were told that some hotels on the island have a more restrictive policy so if you do n’t like water sport it ’s worth thinking. Also there is no much to do around as restaurants and shops are very few. Otherwise really beautiful place.
